name: Quaker Porridge Oats 1Kg
description: Caring for those who need it most
In partnership with the charity Magic Breakfast to provide free porridge to children in the primary schools in greatest need. www.magicbreakfast.com

Enjoy as part of a varied and balanced diet and a healthy lifestyle. Oat beta glucan has been shown to lower blood cholesterol. High cholesterol is a risk factor in the development of coronary heart disease. Coronary heart disease has multiple risk factors and altering one of these risk factors may or may not have a beneficial effect.

As much as you do. That's why we've created an online community called Quaker Bakers where you can view a whole range of 'oaty' recipes from sensational starters to delicious deserts, and share your own tasty tips with fellow oat lovers at www.quakers.co.uk/recipes.

Our oat experts at the Quaker mill in Cupar, Scotland, are passionate about oats and how versatile they are in all sorts of recipes, both savoury and sweet. For inspiration to get baking they have shared a few of their favourites including the recipe on this pack
For further information on cooking instructions and microwave settings, please visit our website: www.quaker.co.uk
We have committed to reduce the carbon footprint of this product
usage: <Cooking_Instructions><Number_Of_Uses>25 This pack contains 25 servings</Number_Of_Uses><Preparation_and_Usage>If you have time...Mix 40g of Quaker Oats with 300ml of milk (or cold water) in a saucepan and bring to the boil.Simmer for 5 minutes.If you're in a rush...To serve: 1, Ingredients: Quaker Oats 40g (3/4 cup), Milk/Water 300ml (1 cup), Cooking Time: Category D (min 700W) 4 minutes, Category E (min 800W) 3 1/2 minutesTo serve: 2, Ingredients: Quaker Oats 80g (1 1/2 cups), Milk/Water 600ml (3 cups), Cooking Time: Category D (min 700W) 6 1/2 minutes, Category E (min 800W) 6 minutes</Preparation_and_Usage><Recipes>Wendy White's Apple and Oat Pancakes with Summer Berry Compote(Serves 2)Ingredients: 75g Quaker Oats, 125g plain flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 2-3 tbsp caster sugar, pinch of cinnamon, 2 eating apples, 300ml milk, 2 egg whites, oilFor the compote: 50g caster sugar, 125g frozen summer berriesMethod:1. Place all the dry ingredients in a bowl and mix well. Core, peel and cut the apples into small squares. Combine the milk and apple pieces with the dry ingredients. Whisk the egg whites to stiff peaks and gently fold into the oat mixture.2. Place the berries and sugar in a pan. Place on a high heat, bring to the boil and then reduce to a simmer. Cook until the berries start to break down and the sauce begins to thicken.3. Heat a drop of oil in a non-stick pan and place 1 1/2 tbsp of the pancake mixture in the pan. Cook on both sides until golden brown. Serve warm with the compote.Makes approx 6 small pancakes.</Recipes></Cooking_Instructions>
